analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang @177a *//
translated: the vidyādhara

original: dus gsum du khrus byas pas rig sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas brjod byed bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du khrus byas pas rig sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas brjod byed bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Having bathed three times during the day, one should make offerings to the Blessed Lady while reciting the king of spells.

original: de nas phyed red lag na pog phor thogs la gtso bo lag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyed red lag na pog phor thogs la gtso bo lag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma spyan drang bar bya'o //

original: de nas nub mo rmi lam du lha mo mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nub mo rmi lam du lha mo mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, during the night, one will see the goddess in one’s dream.

original: de nas nang par langs te khrus byas la gtso bo lag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa byas nas bla ma dang / dge slong gang yang rung ba gcig dang / bdag dang mi gsum la mchod ston bya ste /
analyzed: de nas nang par langs te khrus byas la gtso bo lag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod pa byas nas bla ma dang / dge slong gang yang rung ba gcig dang / bdag dang mi gsum la mchod ston bya ste /
translated: Then, having risen in the morning and bathed, one should make offerings to the chief Vajrapāṇi and the Blessed Lady, and one should prepare a feast for oneself, a guru, and any other monks,

original: bla ma ni; rig sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas brjod byed bzhin du bla ma'i stan la lho phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug tu gzhug go /
analyzed: bla ma ni; rig sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas brjod byed bzhin du bla ma'i stan la lho phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug tu gzhug go /

original: dge slong gcig shos ni /
analyzed: dge slong gcig shos ni /
translated: The other monk

original: shar phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug tu gzhug cing gzugs bzang ma bzlas brjod byed bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug tu gzhug cing gzugs bzang ma bzlas brjod byed bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //

original: bdag ni / spyan bzlas brjod byed bzhin du nub phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug la bla ma'i mdun du dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / spyan bzlas brjod byed bzhin du nub phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug la bla ma'i mdun du dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: I myself, facing west, should sit reciting the Avalokiteśvara-dhāraṇī, and should offer incense, flowers, and perfume in front of the guru.

original: dge slong de la yang dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la yang dbul bar bya'o //
translated: I should also offer them to the monk.

original: bdag gi rkang pa la yang dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rkang pa la yang dbul bar bya'o //
translated: I should also offer them to my own feet.

original: bla ma la ni /
analyzed: bla ma la ni /
translated: To the guru

original: sa ma ta'i 'khur ba la sogs pa zas sna tshogs sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sa ma ta'i 'khur ba la sogs pa zas sna tshogs sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I should offer various foods, such as samata cakes.

original: dge slong de la ni /🔽'o ma'i thug pa dang / zho'i thug pa dang / sbyar thug gi zas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la ni / 'o ma'i thug pa dang / zho'i thug pa dang / sbyar thug gi zas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: To the monk🔽I should offer milk-rice, curd-rice, and cooked vegetables.

original: bdag gis kyang de bzhin du @177b zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i zas gnang ba gang yin pa rnams bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang de bzhin du @177b zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i zas gnang ba gang yin pa rnams bza' bar bya ste /
translated: I myself should also eat the foods that are permitted, which are endowed with curd, milk, butter, and so forth.

original: mgo mnyam du zas bza' zhing zas slong ba la gang gis kyang zas sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mgo mnyam du zas bza' zhing zas slong ba la gang gis kyang zas sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: One should eat the food equally with the head, and no one should give food to the one who begs for food.

original: bla ma'i snod ni /
analyzed: bla ma'i snod ni /
translated: The vessel of the guru

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal pos gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal pos gdab par bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong de'i yang gzugs bzang mas gdab bo //
translated: The one of the bhikṣu should be sprinkled with the good form.

original: bdag gi ni /
analyzed: bdag gi ni /
translated: The one of myself

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma btab ste bza' bar bya'o //

original: de nas zos zin nas bla ma la rdo rje'i rigs bdag la dga' bar gyur cig ces smos shig /
analyzed: de nas zos zin nas bla ma la rdo rje'i rigs bdag la dga' bar gyur cig ces smos shig /
translated: Then, after eating, one should say to the guru, ‘May the lord of the vajra family be pleased with me.’

analyzed: dge slong la yang phyag rgya'i tshogs bdag la dga' bar gyur cig ces smos shig /
translated: One should say to the bhikṣu, ‘May the lord of the assembly of consorts be pleased with me.’

original: bdag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal po gzugs bzang ma dang spyan bzlas brjod byed bzhin du cho ga rgyas pa'i lha rdo rje'i rigs dang bcas pa bdag la dga' bar gyur cig /🔽ces smras par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal po gzugs bzang ma dang spyan bzlas brjod byed bzhin du cho ga rgyas pa'i lha rdo rje'i rigs dang bcas pa bdag la dga' bar gyur cig / ces smras par bya ste /
translated: One should also say, ‘May the king of spells, the good form, and the recitation of the eyes, together with the gods of the extensive rite and the vajra family, be pleased with me.’

original: bla ma'i lag pa g-yas pa nas bzung nas lan gsum du smos shig /
analyzed: bla ma'i lag pa g-yas pa nas bzung nas lan gsum du smos shig /
translated: One should hold the right hand of the guru and say it three times.

original: de nas cho ga rgyas pa'i lha thams cad rdo rje rigs dang bcas pa rnams grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas cho ga rgyas pa'i lha thams cad rdo rje rigs dang bcas pa rnams grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, all the deities of the extensive rite, together with the Vajra family, will be accomplished.

original: de'i nub mo nam phyed kyi dus su bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje lha thams cad kyis bskor ba mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i nub mo nam phyed kyi dus su bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje lha thams cad kyis bskor ba mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: At midnight on that night, one will see Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi surrounded by all the deities.

original: nang bar mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: nang bar mchod pa bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings in the morning.

original: 'di ni / las thams cad kyi nang na las dam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / las thams cad kyi nang na las dam pa ste /
translated: This is the most excellent rite among all rites,

original: mchog tu gsang ba yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba yin no //
translated: and it is the most secret.

original: ji ltar tshogs thams cad kyi nang na rig sngags kyi rgyal po mchog yin pa bzhin du m'a ma k'i dang / @178a *//
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs thams cad kyi nang na rig sngags kyi rgyal po mchog yin pa bzhin du m'a ma k'i dang / @178a *//
translated: Just as the king of mantras is the most excellent among all the assemblies, so also Māmakī,

original: klu mgo can dang / phreng ba 'dzin dang / gdong dmar rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar bstan te /
analyzed: klu mgo can dang / phreng ba 'dzin dang / gdong dmar rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar bstan te /
translated: the one with the nāga head, the one holding the garland, and the red-faced one are taught to be like that.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ni / las thams cad du lha thams cad la drag tu skul pa zhes bya ba dang / lha rnams dbang du byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / las thams cad du lha thams cad la drag tu skul pa zhes bya ba dang / lha rnams dbang du byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: this is called “the summoning of all the deities in all rites” and “the subjugation of the deities.”

original: cho ga rgyas pa 'di khang stong gtsang mar gdon par byed pa gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: cho ga rgyas pa 'di khang stong gtsang mar gdon par byed pa gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: Whoever performs this extensive rite in an empty, clean house,

analyzed: lag na rdo rjes bshad pa bzhin du m'a ma k'i'i tshogs dang bcas par nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will certainly accomplish [the rite] together with the assembly of Māmakīs, as explained by Vajrapāṇi.

original: nang par langs nas tshogs rnams dang / m'a ma k'i dang bcas pa'i ming yang dag par dran par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: nang par langs nas tshogs rnams dang / m'a ma k'i dang bcas pa'i ming yang dag par dran par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Whoever, having risen in the morning, recollects the names together with the assembly and Māmakī,

original: mtshams med pa'ang grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'ang grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: he will be liberated even from the heinous crimes.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His perfections will increase.

original: de nas m'a ma k'i bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas m'a ma k'i bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Then one should accomplish Māmakī.

original: thog mar gzugs bzang mas las byas la de nas m'a ma k'i bzlas brjod bya ste /
analyzed: thog mar gzugs bzang mas las byas la de nas m'a ma k'i bzlas brjod bya ste /
translated: First, a beautiful woman should perform the rite, then she should recite the mantra of Māmakī.

original: de m'a ma k'is bstan na lha thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de m'a ma k'is bstan na lha thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If she is taught by Māmakī, all the gods will come.

original: de dag gzugs bzang mas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gzugs bzang mas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: They should be offered incense, flowers, and perfume by the beautiful woman.

analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rig sngags 'chang gis bla ma la mchod pa byas nas m'a ma k'i bslang par bya'o //

original: bla mas kyang sems mnyam par bzhag pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas la rig sngags kyi rgyal po bzlas brjod byed bzhin du sbyin bar bya'o //

translated: The guru, too, having paid homage to all the tathāgatas with a mind in equipoise, should recite the king of knowledge-mantras and give [the initiation].

original: de nas rig sngags @178b 'chang gis m'a ma k'i bslangs nas dngos grub bslang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags @178b 'chang gis m'a ma k'i bslangs nas dngos grub bslang bar bya ste /
translated: Then, the knowledge-mantra bearer, having invoked Māmakī, should invoke the spiritual powers.

original: bla mas gang smras pa de de la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla mas gang smras pa de de la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever the guru says, that will be accomplished for him.

original: lha rnams / ngas kyang m'a ma k'i blangs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: lha rnams / ngas kyang m'a ma k'i blangs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas so //
translated: O gods, I too, having invoked Māmakī, perfected the six perfections.

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang m'a ma k'i mchod dam 'chang bar byed pa gang yin pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the knowledge-mantra bearer who worships or upholds Māmakī, the six perfections will manifest.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon du phyogs par gyur pas rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon du phyogs par gyur pas rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The six perfections will be actualized, and the knowledge mantra will be accomplished.

original: ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of the lower realms.🔽Those who pay homage to Māmakī, make offerings to her with flowers,

analyzed: m'a ma k'i la phyag 'tshal zhing me tog gis mchod pa byed pa dang / dri dang / bdug pa dang / gser gyis mchod pa gang yin pa des ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin la bskur sti byas pa dang / bla mar byas pa dang / rjed pa dang / mchod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be venerating, honoring, respecting, and worshipping the nature of the Tathāgata.🔽Whoever makes an image of Māmakī, places it as before, sits on a seat of kuśa grass, and recites the mantra one thousand times with good-quality lotuses,

original: gang gis m'a ma k'i'i sku gzugs byas la cho ga snga ma bzhin du bzhag nas ku sha'i stan la 'dug ste nyi ma bzang ba la padma stong gis bsnun na; m'a ma k'i'i khong nas 'od zer gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gis m'a ma k'i'i sku gzugs byas la cho ga snga ma bzhin du bzhag nas ku sha'i stan la 'dug ste nyi ma bzang ba la padma stong gis bsnun na; m'a ma k'i'i khong nas 'od zer gcig 'byung ste /
translated: a single light ray will emerge from within Māmakī.

original: rig sngags 'chang de la g-yas phyogs su bskor nas rna ba g-yas pa'i nang du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang de la g-yas phyogs su bskor nas rna ba g-yas pa'i nang du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will circle to the right of the knowledge-holder and enter into his right ear.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang gis mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Then the knowledge-mantra holder will attain supernormal knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: He will see the Tathāgatas and the Bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje pho @179a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje pho @179a *//
translated: He will also see Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi

original: nya ma'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nya ma'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: together with the assembly of his retinue.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rjes rig sngags de blangs nas dga' ldan gyi gnas su 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rjes rig sngags de blangs nas dga' ldan gyi gnas su 'jog par byed do //
translated: Then Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi, having taken up that knowledge-mantra, will place it in the Tuṣita realm.

original: 'phags pa byams pa dang lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa dang lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will dwell together with the noble Maitreya.

original: m'a ma k'i sman brgyad dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: m'a ma k'i sman brgyad dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: He will see Māmakī endowed with the eight medicines.

original: mthong bas cho ga rgyas par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong bas cho ga rgyas par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is seen will be accomplished through the extensive ritual.

original: rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rig sngags 'grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The signs of the accomplishment of the knowledge-mantra will also arise.

original: 'dod rgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can gyi bar du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod rgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can gyi bar du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to having a form that can transform at will.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i cho ga yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i cho ga yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will also explain the ritual of Bhagavatī.

original: sgrub pa thams cad la phyag rgya gcig gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa thams cad la phyag rgya gcig gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In all sādhanas, one should place a single mudrā.

original: phyag rgyas btab na /
analyzed: phyag rgyas btab na /
translated: If one is sealed with a mudrā,

original: sgrub pa la myur du dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa la myur du dngos grub kyi mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the signs of siddhi will quickly arise in the sādhana.

original: dam tshig mi shes pa la ni /
analyzed: dam tshig mi shes pa la ni /
translated: For one who does not know the samaya,

original: phyag rgya bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not display the mudrā.

original: gang gi tshe rig sngags 'chang gis rig sngags 'chang la phyag rgya bstan pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje'i mdun du 'gron bu brgyad brgyas rdo rje byas la rdo rje de'i mdun du phyag rgya bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig sngags 'chang gis rig sngags 'chang la phyag rgya bstan pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje'i mdun du 'gron bu brgyad brgyas rdo rje byas la rdo rje de'i mdun du phyag rgya bstan par bya'o //
translated: When a vidyādhara displays a mudrā to a vidyādhara, at that time, in front of Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi, one should make eight hundred vajras with bricks and display the mudrā in front of those vajras.

original: bla ma la dad pas kyang rdo rje la mchod yon phul nas bla ma la yon phul te phyag rgya blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma la dad pas kyang rdo rje la mchod yon phul nas bla ma la yon phul te phyag rgya blta bar bya'o //
translated: Also, with faith in the guru, having offered a libation to the vajra, having offered a gift to the guru, one should view the mudrā.

original: mthong na lag na rdo rje mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: mthong na lag na rdo rje mthong ba yin te /
translated: If seen, it is as if Vajrapāṇi is seen.

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa rnams la bstan par bya'o //
translated: It should be displayed to those who have generated the mind of awakening.

original: sdig pa byed pa rnams la bstan par mi @179b bya'o; ;sdig pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa rnams la bstan par mi @179b bya'o; ;sdig pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
translated: It should not be taught to those who commit evil.

original: phyag rgya'i tshogs kyi ming yang mi shes te /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i tshogs kyi ming yang mi shes te /
translated: Those who commit evil do not even know the names of the collection of mudrās.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa gang yin pa de dag gis ni /
translated: Those who have accumulated roots of virtue🔽will attain this mudrā.

original: phyag rgya 'di thob par 'gyur ro; ;nga'i phyag rgya'i tshogs gsang ba 'di ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di thob par 'gyur ro; ;nga'i phyag rgya'i tshogs gsang ba 'di ni /
translated: This secret collection of my mudrās

original: gtsang ba dang / dben par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtsang ba dang / dben par blta bar bya ste /
translated: should be seen as pure and secluded.

original: phyag rgya mthong ba gang yin pa de dag la ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya mthong ba gang yin pa de dag la ni /
translated: Those who see the mudrās

original: rig pa mchog gi cho ga rgyas pa gsang pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rig pa mchog gi cho ga rgyas pa gsang pa dang bcas pa /
translated: will have in their hands the extensive ritual of the supreme knowledge mantra together with the secret

original: gsang chen dang bcas pa lag tu son pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang chen dang bcas pa lag tu son pa yin no //
translated: and the great secret.

original: rig sngags 'chang gis kyang phyag rgya'i tshogs kyi drung du bla ma la dpag tu med pa'i yon phul la bla ma'i lag nas rig pa mchog gi cho ga rgyas pa nod par bya ste /

original: drung du bzhag pa ni /

analyzed: rdo rje nag mo'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de ltar de lta bu'i tshul gyis phyag rgya grangs med par 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de nyid las gung mo dang bcas par brkyang ba ni /

analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //

original: de nyid las mthe bong ril nang du bcug ste sor mo thams cad kyis bsnan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid las mthe bong ril nang du bcug ste sor mo thams cad kyis bsnan pa ni /

analyzed: lag na rdo rje'i khu tshur gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: gdong dmar gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: 'od zer phreng gi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: lag bzang gi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: khro bo thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o // de nyid las g-yas pa brkyang ba ni /

analyzed: khro bo rdo rje rtse gcig ldan gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de nyid las ldog pa ni /

original: snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: snying po'i phyag rgya'o //

translated: From that [position], open the cupped hands, and interlace the little fingers, ring fingers, and middle fingers. Bend the two index fingers and touch them together. Place the two thumbs next to the two ring fingers.

original: lus dmar gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lus dmar gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de nyid las srin lag bsnol ba'i rtse mor mthe bong gnyis bzhag la mthe'u chung dang gung mo tha mal par bkug pa ni /

analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi phyag @189a *//

original: rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya'o //

original: de nyid las ldog ste bkug pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid las ldog ste bkug pa ni /

analyzed: rdo rje 'og pag can gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de ltar de lta bu'i tshul gyis phyag rgya grangs med pa 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de gnyis kyi blo'i tshigs dang por gung mo gnyis bzhag la mdzub mo gnyis so so nas bkug ste mthe bong gnyis glo la gzhar ba ni /

analyzed: klu mgo can gyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: de nyid las gung mo dang / mdzub mo dang / mthe bo klu mgo gdengs ka ltar dgug pa ni /

analyzed: klu thams cad kyi snying po'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: mthe bong gnyis gcig tu sbyar te klu mgo'i gdengs ka ltar byas pa ni /

original: gung mo dang mdzub mo sngon du sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: gung mo dang mdzub mo sngon du sbyar ba ni /

original: lha ma yin thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin thams cad kyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje yangs pa chen po'i phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag rgya @189b las mdzub mo dang gung mo bkug la de'i nang du mthe bong gzhug pa ni /

analyzed: de nyid kyi spyan drang ba'i phyag rgya'o //

original: mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /
analyzed: mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /

original: lag pa gnyis kyi mthil logs kyi sor mo la bltas nas mig gyen khar bsgyur te bteg la glog sgyur ba'i phyag rgya yang bcings nas g-yon pa'i sor mo'i rdo rje'i chen po bstod pa byas na /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi mthil logs kyi sor mo la bltas nas mig gyen khar bsgyur te bteg la glog sgyur ba'i phyag rgya yang bcings nas g-yon pa'i sor mo'i rdo rje'i chen po bstod pa byas na /

original: des lha dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / srin po rnams dang / log 'dren rnams dang / 'gram na gnas pa thams cad dang / tshangs pa dang / skem byed dang / dbang chen dang / drag po la sogs @194b pa'i snying la glog 'gyur ba'i shugs 'di bab pas 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des lha dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / srin po rnams dang / log 'dren rnams dang / 'gram na gnas pa thams cad dang / tshangs pa dang / skem byed dang / dbang chen dang / drag po la sogs @194b pa'i snying la glog 'gyur ba'i shugs 'di bab pas 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By this, all the gods, yakshas, asuras, nagas, rakshasas, and maras, as well as all those who dwell nearby, Brahma, Rudra, Mahesha, Shiva, and so forth, will come, their hearts struck by the force of the lightning flash.

original: mthu stobs bcom nas rdo rje'i rjes su mthun dang dul zhing rdo rje la 'dud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthu stobs bcom nas rdo rje'i rjes su mthun dang dul zhing rdo rje la 'dud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been conquered by [the yogin's] power, they will follow the vajra, become disciplined, and bow to the vajra.

original: de dag gi phyir zhi bar byas na /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir zhi bar byas na /
translated: If they are to be pacified,

original: de'i tshe phyag rgya de snying gar bkrol ba de dag de'i mod la mthun par bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhing byams pa'i sems dang ldan par bzlas brjod bya'o; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyag rgya de snying gar bkrol ba de dag de'i mod la mthun par bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhing byams pa'i sems dang ldan par bzlas brjod bya'o; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid 'byung ste /
translated: Then, the characteristics of the seal of Vajra-Chains will arise.

original: lag pa g-yon pa phyir bstan /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa phyir bstan /
translated: The left hand is turned outward,🔽and the right hand is turned inward, and they are joined together.🔽The fingers hold the little finger of the left hand, starting from the left, and wrap around it.🔽The elbows are joined, and the seal is placed at the heart.

original: g-yas pa nang du bstan te gcig tu sbyar nas lag pa'i sor mo rnams kyis g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te re re nas bzung ste dkris la gru mo bsnyams nas phyag rgya snying gar bzhag ste mthe bong gnyis kyis so so'i srin lag mnan la lag
analyzed: g-yas pa nang du bstan te gcig tu sbyar nas lag pa'i sor mo rnams kyis g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung nas brtsams te re re nas bzung ste dkris la gru mo bsnyams nas phyag rgya snying gar bzhag ste mthe bong gnyis kyis so so'i srin lag mnan la lag

original: pa gnyis phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pa gnyis phyir bstan pa ni /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the root seal of the Blessed Vajra-Chains.

original: thabs de nyid las lag pa gnyis bkan pa ni /
analyzed: thabs de nyid las lag pa gnyis bkan pa ni /
translated: From that method, the two hands are turned over.

original: bcings pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the binding seal.

original: lag pa gnyis ka'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gang bu ltar phan tshun sprad pa 'di ni /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ka'i mdzub mo dang mthe bong gang bu ltar phan tshun sprad pa 'di ni /
translated: The fingers and thumbs of both hands are crossed like a braid.

original: rdo rje lu gu rgyud tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje lu gu rgyud tha dad pa yin no //
translated: This is the mudrā of the vajra chain.

original: mthe bong gnyis bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis bskyed pa ni /

original: rdo rje sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sgrog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the vajra hook.

original: g-yon pa bkan pa g-yas pa khas phub ste sor mo rnams gcig la gcig bsdams pa 'di yang rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa bkan pa g-yas pa khas phub ste sor mo rnams gcig la gcig bsdams pa 'di yang rdo rje lu gu rgyud kyi phyag rgya yin no //
translated: The left hand is turned over, and the fingers of the right hand are locked with the fingers of the left hand. This is also the mudrā of the vajra chain.

original: de las @195a *//
analyzed: de las @195a *//
translated: From that,

original: khu tshur bcangs te mthe bong gnyis brkyang ba ni /
analyzed: khu tshur bcangs te mthe bong gnyis brkyang ba ni /
translated: the two thumbs are extended.

original: rdo rje thog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the vajra thunderbolt.

original: sor mo rnams phye ste khu tshur bcangs la mdzub mo gnyis kyis mnan te sgra dang bcas par brdab pa ni /
analyzed: sor mo rnams phye ste khu tshur bcangs la mdzub mo gnyis kyis mnan te sgra dang bcas par brdab pa ni /
translated: The fingers are spread, and the two thumbs are pressed with the two index fingers. Striking with sound,

original: dgrol ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dgrol ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: this is the mudrā of the release.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo'i sor mo bsnyams la mdzub mo gnyis so sor bkug ste gung mo gnyis ngos la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo'i sor mo bsnyams la mdzub mo gnyis so sor bkug ste gung mo gnyis ngos la bstan pa ni /
translated: The fingers of the añjali gesture of homage are pressed together, and the two index fingers are bent in, and the two middle fingers are extended.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the Buddha’s eye.

original: phan tshun bsnol te snyim pa bzed la mdzub mo gnyis kyi sen mo gcig gis gcig bkab pa ni /🔽spyan drang ba yin no; ;de las ldog pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun bsnol te snyim pa bzed la mdzub mo gnyis kyi sen mo gcig gis gcig bkab pa ni / spyan drang ba yin no; ;de las ldog pa ni /
translated: Interlocking the hands, with the two index fingers covering each other at the fingernail, is the mudra for summoning.

original: slar gtang ba yin no //🔽de bzhin du lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyi rdo rje tho ba phrag pa logs su bzhag ste lta stangs kyis snying la bsdigs pa ni /
analyzed: slar gtang ba yin no // de bzhin du lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyi rdo rje tho ba phrag pa logs su bzhag ste lta stangs kyis snying la bsdigs pa ni /
translated: Reversing that is the mudra for dismissing.

original: khro bo'i phyag rgya'o //🔽yig 'bru bcu pa'i tshul du byas pa ni /
analyzed: khro bo'i phyag rgya'o // yig 'bru bcu pa'i tshul du byas pa ni /
translated: Likewise, placing the vajra hammer of the right fist on the shoulder, and threatening the heart with the gaze is the mudra of wrath.

original: rdo rje dbyug pa'i yin no //🔽de nyid las bstod pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyug pa'i yin no // de nyid las bstod pa ni /
translated: The mudra of the vajra club is formed by the ten syllables.

analyzed: khro bo 'gro ba'i phyag rgya'o // mthe bong bkyed pa ni /
translated: The mudra of the wrathful one going is formed by the praise.

original: gzhom pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyis g-yon pa'i khu tshur bzung la mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams brkyang ste mdung rtse gsum pa'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /
analyzed: gzhom pa'i phyag rgya'o // g-yas pa'i mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyis g-yon pa'i khu tshur bzung la mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams brkyang ste mdung rtse gsum pa'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /
translated: The mudra of the one to be destroyed is formed by the extended thumb.

original: gtsug nas byung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gtsug nas byung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of the one arising from the crown is formed by holding the left fist with the thumb and small finger of the right hand, and extending the index, middle, and ring fingers in the shape of a three-pointed lance.

original: me lha spyan drang ba'i phyag rgya yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: me lha spyan drang ba'i phyag rgya yang de nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the mudrā for invoking the fire god.🔽The ring finger and middle finger of the left hand are hidden.

original: g-yon pa'i srin lag dang gung mo sbas @195b ba ni; gtsug nas byung gi phyag rgya tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i srin lag dang gung mo sbas @195b ba ni; gtsug nas byung gi phyag rgya tha dad pa yin no //
translated: This is the different mudrā of the Uṣṇīṣa-born.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag dang gung mo bkug pa mthe bos bzung la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis brkyang pa ni /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag dang gung mo bkug pa mthe bos bzung la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis brkyang pa ni /
translated: The ring finger and middle finger of the left hand are bent and held by the thumb, while the index finger and little finger are extended.

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Mahāvajrabhairava.

original: de nyid mdzub mo'i thor to mthe bo'i rtse mo logs su btud pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de nyid mdzub mo'i thor to mthe bo'i rtse mo logs su btud pa 'di ni /
translated: The same, with the tip of the index finger bent to the side of the tip of the thumb,

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed chen po'i phyag rgya tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed chen po'i phyag rgya tha dad pa ste /
translated: is the different mudrā of Mahāvajrabhairava.

original: rdo rje rtse gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse gcig pa yin no //
translated: This is the single-pronged vajra.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha' lding dang dpal gyi be'u'i dbyibs de las mthe'u chung dang srin lag gnyis kyi thor to bkug pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha' lding dang dpal gyi be'u'i dbyibs de las mthe'u chung dang srin lag gnyis kyi thor to bkug pa ni /
translated: Moreover, from that shape of the garuḍa and svastika, the tips of the little and ring fingers are bent.

original: mig gi phyag rgya zhes grags so //
analyzed: mig gi phyag rgya zhes grags so //
translated: This is known as the eye mudrā.

original: mthe'u chung dang srin lag dang gung mo rnams kyi thor to legs par bkug pa ni /
analyzed: mthe'u chung dang srin lag dang gung mo rnams kyi thor to legs par bkug pa ni /
translated: The tips of the little finger, ring finger, and middle finger are well bent.

original: khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Bhṛkuṭī.

original: ming med dang gung mo dang srin lag dang gung mo rnams kyi thor to legs par bkug pa ni /
analyzed: ming med dang gung mo dang srin lag dang gung mo rnams kyi thor to legs par bkug pa ni /
translated: The tips of the ring finger, middle finger, and index finger are well bent.

original: khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Bhṛkuṭī.

original: mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag dang mthe'u chung rnams sprad la mthe bong gnyis kyi thor to gung mo dang srin lag gi mtshams su bzhag pa ni /
analyzed: mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag dang mthe'u chung rnams sprad la mthe bong gnyis kyi thor to gung mo dang srin lag gi mtshams su bzhag pa ni /
translated: The index finger, middle finger, ring finger, and little finger are joined, and the tips of the two thumbs are placed between the middle finger and ring finger.

original: rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Hayagrīva.

original: de nyid las srin lag dang gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs nang du bkug ste mthe'u chung gnyis brkyang pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid las srin lag dang gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs nang du bkug ste mthe'u chung gnyis brkyang pa ni /
translated: From that mudrā, the tips of the ring finger and middle finger are bent inward, and the two little fingers are extended.🔽This is the second mudrā of the tortoise.

original: rus sbal gyi phyag rgya gnyis pa yin no; ;lag pa gnyis bla 'og tu bstan te bsnol la sor mo rnams gcig la gcig dkris nas mthe bong dang mthe'u chung rnams sprad pa ni /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi phyag rgya gnyis pa yin no; ;lag pa gnyis bla 'og tu bstan te bsnol la sor mo rnams gcig la gcig dkris nas mthe bong dang mthe'u chung rnams sprad pa ni /
translated: The two hands are placed one above the other, the fingers intertwined with each other, and the thumbs and little fingers are joined.

original: rus sbal dang rdo rje sa 'og gi @196a *//
analyzed: rus sbal dang rdo rje sa 'og gi @196a *//
translated: The mudrā of the tortoise and the vajra subterranean.

original: phyag rgya'o // lag pa gnyis khu tshur bcangs la gung mo brkyang ste rdo rje ltar byas nas g-yon pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya'o // lag pa gnyis khu tshur bcangs la gung mo brkyang ste rdo rje ltar byas nas g-yon pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /
translated: Make a fist with both hands, extend the middle fingers, and make them like vajras. Extend the index fingers of the left [hand].

original: rdo rje dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the vajra club.

original: sgrol ma'i phyag rgya nyid las mdzub mo gnyis kyi thor to nas gang tsam gyis phye ba ni /
analyzed: sgrol ma'i phyag rgya nyid las mdzub mo gnyis kyi thor to nas gang tsam gyis phye ba ni /
translated: From the mudrā of Tārā, open the tips of the two index fingers one finger-width apart.

original: rdo rje yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Vajra Vast.

original: nas gnyis tsam gyis phye ba ni /
analyzed: nas gnyis tsam gyis phye ba ni /
translated: Open [the fingers] two finger-widths apart.

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ba ni /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ba ni /
translated: Extend the two index fingers.

original: kun tu yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: kun tu yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Samantabhadra.

original: de nas mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste sprad pa ni /
analyzed: de nas mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste sprad pa ni /
translated: Then, extend and join the two index fingers.

original: padma yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: padma yangs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Padma Vast.🔽Extend the two index fingers and touch the tips together.

original: mdzub mo gnyis brkyang mar brjod pa ni; rdo rje sa 'og gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis brkyang mar brjod pa ni; rdo rje sa 'og gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Vajra Underground.

original: de nyid las gung mo gnyis kyi thor to'i tshigs dang po gdu bu ltar bkug la mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo sprad pa ni /🔽rdo rje dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o; ;g-yon pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid las gung mo gnyis kyi thor to'i tshigs dang po gdu bu ltar bkug la mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo sprad pa ni / rdo rje dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o; ;g-yon pa'i mdzub mo brkyang ba ni /
translated: From that mudra, bend the first joint of the two index fingers like a bracelet, and join the tips of the two middle fingers.🔽This is the mudra of the vajra sword.

original: ral gri dang / dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang / dgra sta'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Extending the left index finger is the mudra of the sword and the sword-stick.

original: gung mo dang srin lag gnyis thor to bsnol te sbyar la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung brkyang ste gung mo dang mthe bong gnyis kyi rtse mo sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: gung mo dang srin lag gnyis thor to bsnol te sbyar la mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung brkyang ste gung mo dang mthe bong gnyis kyi rtse mo sbyar ba ni /
translated: Cross the two middle fingers and ring fingers, extend the index and little fingers, and join the tips of the middle and thumb fingers.

original: rdo rje seng+ge'i khri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje seng+ge'i khri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra of the vajra lion throne.

original: mdzub mo dang gung mo gcig la gcig bstan la mthe bong brkyang ste sbyar nas mthe'u chung yang brkyang ste sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: mdzub mo dang gung mo gcig la gcig bstan la mthe bong brkyang ste sbyar nas mthe'u chung yang brkyang ste sbyar ba ni /
translated: Show the index and middle fingers to each other, extend the thumbs and join them, and also extend the little fingers and join them.

original: rdo rje lcags mda'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags mda'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra of the vajra arrow.

original: lag pa gnyis bsnol la mthe bong gnyis bsgreng ste sor gnyis tsam gyis phye ba ni /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis bsnol la mthe bong gnyis bsgreng ste sor gnyis tsam gyis phye ba ni /
translated: Cross the two hands, extend the two thumbs, and separate them about two fingerbreadths apart.

original: rus sbal gyi phyag rgya dang / @196b phur bu dbyung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi phyag rgya dang / @196b phur bu dbyung ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the mudrā of extracting the kīla.

original: lag pa gnyis bsnol te sor mo thams cad sbyar bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis bsnol te sor mo thams cad sbyar bar bya ba ni /
translated: The two hands are crossed, and all the fingers are joined.

original: rdo rje ra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the vajra fence.

original: lag pa gnyis bkan la mthe'u chung nang du sbyar te mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams rgyab tu bsgrengs nas mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams kyis mnan te mthe bong gnyis rus sbal gyi phyag rgya bzhin du byas pa ni; shes rab
analyzed: lag pa gnyis bkan la mthe'u chung nang du sbyar te mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams rgyab tu bsgrengs nas mdzub mo dang gung mo dang srin lag rnams kyis mnan te mthe bong gnyis rus sbal gyi phyag rgya bzhin du byas pa ni; shes rab
translated: The two hands are turned over, the little fingers are joined inside, and the index, middle, and ring fingers are extended behind. The index, middle, and ring fingers are pressed down with the two thumbs made like the mudrā of the tortoise.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the perfection of wisdom.

original: srin lag nang du bkug la mthe bong gnyis kyi tshigs drang por mnan te mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dang por sbyar nas mthe'u chung gnyis drang por sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: srin lag nang du bkug la mthe bong gnyis kyi tshigs drang por mnan te mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dang por sbyar nas mthe'u chung gnyis drang por sbyar ba ni /
translated: The ring fingers are bent inside, and the two thumbs press down on the joints of the two index fingers. The tips of the two index fingers are joined to the first joint of the two middle fingers, and the two little fingers are joined straight.

original: mtshon cha chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the great weapon.

original: de nyid las mdzub mo gung mo gnyis kyi sen mo la brten pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo gung mo gnyis kyi sen mo la brten pa ni /
translated: The same mudrā, with the index and middle fingers touching at the fingernails,🔽is the supreme weapon mudrā.

original: mtshon cha mchog gi phyag rgya'o; ;mtshon cha chen po'i phyag rgya de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dang po'i bsrubs kyi glor gzhar ba ni /
analyzed: mtshon cha mchog gi phyag rgya'o; ;mtshon cha chen po'i phyag rgya de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dang po'i bsrubs kyi glor gzhar ba ni /
translated: The same great weapon mudrā, with the two index fingers placed at the first joint of the two middle fingers,

original: mtshon cha'i shugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha'i shugs kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: is the mudrā of the power of the weapon.

original: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis kyi thor to gung mo'i tshigs dang po nas cung zad bkug ste gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dbu mar sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis kyi thor to gung mo'i tshigs dang po nas cung zad bkug ste gung mo gnyis kyi tshigs dbu mar sbyar ba ni /
translated: The same mudrā, with the tips of the two index fingers slightly bent from the first joint of the middle fingers, and the two middle fingers joined at the middle joint,

original: mtshon cha'i snying po yin no //
analyzed: mtshon cha'i snying po yin no //
translated: is the essence of the weapon.

original: mtshon cha chen po de nyid las srin lag dang mthe bong ngos sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: mtshon cha chen po de nyid las srin lag dang mthe bong ngos sbyar ba ni /
translated: The same great weapon, with the ring fingers and thumbs joined,

translated: is the seeking weapon.

original: lag pa'i phyag rgya drang thabs su byas pa ni /

original: nam mkha' lding gi dpal be'u'i phyag rgya ltar srin lag phye ste mthe bong gnyis drang bor gshibs pa yang rdo rje dbyug sngon gyi phyag rgya'o //🔽de nyid las mthe bong gnyis kyi tshigs dang po legs par bkug ste srin lag gnyis kyi drung du brten pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dpal be'u'i phyag rgya ltar srin lag phye ste mthe bong gnyis drang bor gshibs pa yang rdo rje dbyug sngon gyi phyag rgya'o // de nyid las mthe bong gnyis kyi tshigs dang po legs par bkug ste srin lag gnyis kyi drung du brten pa ni /
translated: The mudrā of the glorious noose of Garuḍa is to separate the ring fingers and straighten the two thumbs.🔽The mudrā of Vajra Blue Acala is to bend the first joint of the two thumbs and place them next to the two ring fingers.

original: rdo rje dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽mda' bo che'i dbyibs ltar gung mo gnyis kyi drung du mthe bong gnyis gshibs pa'i rtse mo bkug pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyug pa'i phyag rgya'o // mda' bo che'i dbyibs ltar gung mo gnyis kyi drung du mthe bong gnyis gshibs pa'i rtse mo bkug pa ni /
translated: The mudrā of Vajra Club is to bend the tips of the two middle fingers next to the two thumbs, which are placed together.

original: gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Uṣṇīṣa is to bend the tips of the two thumbs together and place them next to the two middle fingers, which are shaped like a large arrow.

original: padma'i gdan gyi dbyibs ltar byas te gung mo gnyis kyi thor to sprad pa ni /🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: padma'i gdan gyi dbyibs ltar byas te gung mo gnyis kyi thor to sprad pa ni / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Avalokiteśvara is to place the tips of the two middle fingers together, like the shape of a lotus seat.

original: mthe'u chung dang srin lag gdu bu ltar bkug la de bzhin du sprad /
analyzed: mthe'u chung dang srin lag gdu bu ltar bkug la de bzhin du sprad /

original: gung mo gnyis gshibs pa mnan nas gshibs pa'i tshigs dang por mdzub mo gnyis gzhar ba ni /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis gshibs pa mnan nas gshibs pa'i tshigs dang por mdzub mo gnyis gzhar ba ni /
translated: pressing down on the two middle fingers, and to place the two index fingers on the first joint of the two middle fingers.

original: 'dod pa'i rdo rje ma'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rdo rje ma'i'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Kāmaratna.

original: de nyid las mthe bong gnyis sen mo sprad pa de la srin lag gnyis sbyar ba ni; lus las byung gi phyag rgya'o //🔽thal ba'i khu tshur ni /
analyzed: de nyid las mthe bong gnyis sen mo sprad pa de la srin lag gnyis sbyar ba ni; lus las byung gi phyag rgya'o // thal ba'i khu tshur ni /
translated: The same mudrā with the two index fingers touching at the tips and the two thumbs touching at the tips is the mudrā of Kāyavajra.

original: 'joms byed lnga'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'joms byed lnga'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of the five destroyers is as follows.

original: lag pa gnyis bkan te sor mo'i phyi rol tu bsnol mar brkyang la mdzub mo bsrang ste thor tor sbyar nas mthe bong brkyangs nas mdung rtse gsum pa'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /

translated: Cross the two hands behind the back, with the fingers interlaced and extended.

original: ta mu'i phyag rgya'o //🔽mthe'u chung dang srin lag gi thor to mthe bos mnan @197b la sor mo lhag ma rnams brkyang ste mdung rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: ta mu'i phyag rgya'o // mthe'u chung dang srin lag gi thor to mthe bos mnan @197b la sor mo lhag ma rnams brkyang ste mdung rtse gsum pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Tamuni is as follows.🔽Press the tips of the little and ring fingers with the thumbs, extend the remaining fingers, and form the shape of a trident.

original: lag pa gnyis bkan te sor mo'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis bkan te sor mo'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /

analyzed: lus dpag med kyi phyag rgya'o // lag pa gnyis glang po che'i sna'i dbyibs ltar byas pa ni /

original: 'jigs byed kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Bhairava is as follows.

original: smin ma yang bkug pa ni /
analyzed: smin ma yang bkug pa ni /

original: khro bo dbang phyug gi yin te /🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: khro bo dbang phyug gi yin te / 'di dag ni /

original: rigs kyi rgyal po bco brgyad kyi phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi rgyal po bco brgyad kyi phyag rgya yin no //

analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis so so'i gung mo'i drung du bkug pa ni /

analyzed: log 'dren rnams kyi phyag rgya'o // lag pa'i khu tshur nam mkha' ltar //
translated: This is the mudrā of the evil ones.🔽The two fists are like space,

analyzed: khong stong sbyar nas de bzhin du //
translated: joined hollow side to hollow side.

original: mthe bong gnyis kyang bstod pa ni //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis kyang bstod pa ni //

original: tshangs pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes ni bya bar bshad //
